DOC.brief_summary: Randomized clinical trial compare effectiveness safety double ( traditional ) versus single ( Asian ) cup technique chronic low back pain .
DOC.brief_title: Wet Cupping ( AlHijamah ) ; Double Versus Single Cupping Technique
DOC.detailed_description: Chronic Low Back Pain common pain disorder primary care . As many chronic pain condition , patient usually ask alternative option , especially local traditional therapy include wet cupping , replace long-term use painkiller . The majority wet cup trial conduct abroad use different technique , different local traditional wet cupping technique . This study identify technique efficacious reduce pain , prolong pain relieve period , decrease patient dependence painkiller chronic low back pain.The aim study compare effectiveness safety double ( traditional ) versus single ( Asian ) cup technique chronic low back pain . This randomized comparative effectiveness pilot clinical trial . After take write informed consent , patient chronic low back pain randomized two group , one group receive wet cup therapy Traditional double technique , group receive Asian single technique . Numeric Rating Scale , Present Pain Intensity Oswestry Disability Questionnaire use measure outcome intervention , one week intervention , two week . Wilcoxon rank sum test continuous dependent data analysis analysis covariance ANCOVA , compare group mean score use . The outcome baseline score use covariate . Chi square Fisher 's exact test use compare categorical data Minimal Clinical Improvement Difference within two group .
DOC.criteria: Male Female Age equal 18 year 60 year Chronic low back pain ( least duration â‰¥ 3 month ) Not antiinflammatory pain killer last 15 day . Patients receive wetcupping therapy last three month Patients low back pain due specific know etiological cause ( infection , tumor , osteoporosis , ankylose spondylitis , fracture , inflammatory process , radicular syndrome , cauda equinal syndrome ) Patients inappropriate wet cup treatment ( AIDS , Hepatitis , Tuberculosis , Syphilis . The refer physician advise exclude patient ) Patients currently receive anticoagulant , antiplatelet medication Anemia , thrombocytopenia , Coagulopathy Hemorrhagic disease like hemophilia Had undergone surgery , bleed injury , blood donation Uncontrolled hypertension , Ischemic heart disease , previous transient ischemic attack stroke Diabetes , know renal / hepatic disease Patients pregnancy plan conception Previously currently drug addict Any severe disease disable medical condition
